original: @108b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @108b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i tsa kra samba ree ka b'i ra s'a dha nam /
analyzed: shr'i tsa kra samba ree ka b'i ra s'a dha nam /
translated: Śrīcakrasaṃvarāyikāvarasādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa dpa' bo gcig pa'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa dpa' bo gcig pa'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The glorious Cakrasaṃvara practice of the solitary hero

original: dpal 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Mañjuvajra.

original: dang por re zhig dur khrod la sogs pa yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su /
analyzed: dang por re zhig dur khrod la sogs pa yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su /
translated: First, in a place that is pleasing to the mind, such as a charnel ground,

original: rnal 'byor pa ro'i gdan la gcer bu skra grol bas gnas te /🔽rang gi snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i yi ge h'um gi 'od zer rnams kyis bdag nyid zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'i he ru ka rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ro'i gdan la gcer bu skra grol bas gnas te / rang gi snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i yi ge h'um gi 'od zer rnams kyis bdag nyid zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'i he ru ka rnam par bsams nas /
translated: the yogī, naked and with loose hair, sits on a corpse seat.🔽Having visualized oneself as Heruka with one face and two arms,

original: rang gi zhal nas a'a li k'a li thog mar aom dang mthar h'um h'um phat phat dang ldan pa spros te de nyid du zhugs pa na /
analyzed: rang gi zhal nas a'a li k'a li thog mar aom dang mthar h'um h'um phat phat dang ldan pa spros te de nyid du zhugs pa na /
translated: one imagines that light rays from the syllable hūṃ located on a sun in one's heart radiate out, and having emanated the Sanskrit alphabet beginning with oṃ and ending with hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ from one's mouth, they enter right there.

original: shr'i yig gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: shr'i yig gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: The two syllables śrī are the nondual wisdom,

original: he zhes rgyu sogs stong pa nyid //
analyzed: he zhes rgyu sogs stong pa nyid //
translated: he is the emptiness of causes and so on,

original: ru yig bkod pa dang bral ba //
analyzed: ru yig bkod pa dang bral ba //
translated: and ru is free from arrangement.

original: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Ka is not located anywhere.

original: zhes yi ge bzhi'i don mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: zhes yi ge bzhi'i don mngon du bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should actualize the meaning of the four syllables.

original: de nas yi ge h'um gi 'od zer rnams kyis mdun du bla ma dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa bltas la /
analyzed: de nas yi ge h'um gi 'od zer rnams kyis mdun du bla ma dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa bltas la /
translated: Then, having seen the light rays of the syllable hūṃ in front, one should make offerings to the guru, perfect buddhas, and so on.

original: yang dag par mchod de phyag 'tshal nas bzod par gsol lo //
analyzed: yang dag par mchod de phyag 'tshal nas bzod par gsol lo //
translated: Having made offerings and prostrations, one should request forbearance.

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags //
translated: I confess each and every misdeed.

original: 'gro ba'i bsod nams rjes yi rang ;
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsod nams rjes yi rang ;
translated: I rejoice in the merit of beings.

original: / sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //
translated: I hold the mind of enlightenment.

original: byang chub mchog gi sems ni bdag gis bskyed //
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi sems ni bdag gis bskyed //
translated: I generate the supreme mind of enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad bdag gis mgron du gnyer //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag gis mgron du gnyer //
translated: I invite all sentient beings.

original: byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad pa yis //
translated: Having practiced the supreme, delightful conduct of enlightenment,🔽may I attain buddhahood for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / de'i rjes la sems can thams @109a * //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / de'i rjes la sems can thams @109a * //
translated: After that, all sentient beings are invited with the five branches of approach and close approach.

original: cad bde ba nye par sdud pa'i rnam pa can gyi byams pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'don pa'i rnam pa can gyi snying rje dang / thams cad bde ba rgyun mi 'chad par mos pa'i rnam pa can gyi dga' ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad kyis dben pa'i rnam pa can gyi btang snyoms bsgoms te /
analyzed: cad bde ba nye par sdud pa'i rnam pa can gyi byams pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'don pa'i rnam pa can gyi snying rje dang / thams cad bde ba rgyun mi 'chad par mos pa'i rnam pa can gyi dga' ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad kyis dben pa'i rnam pa can gyi btang snyoms bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on love, which has the aspect of bringing about the happiness of all, on compassion, which has the aspect of liberating from the causes of suffering, on joy, which has the aspect of aspiring to the uninterrupted happiness of all, and on equanimity, which has the aspect of being free from the eight worldly concerns.🔽Recite:

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sv'a bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sv'a bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: oṃ śuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ śuddho ’haṃ

original: zhes brjod la chos thams cad brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can du dmigs la 'gro ba gsum po rnams dang / bdag kyang h'um gi thig ler chud par byas la /
analyzed: zhes brjod la chos thams cad brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can du dmigs la 'gro ba gsum po rnams dang / bdag kyang h'um gi thig ler chud par byas la /
translated: and imagine that all phenomena are false and deceptive. Then, imagine that the three realms and you yourself enter into the bindu of hūṃ.🔽Recite:

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: oṃ śūnyatājñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ

original: zhes brjod de sngags kyi don du brjod pas mi dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod de sngags kyi don du brjod pas mi dmigs par bya'o //
translated: and imagine that you are reciting the meaning of the mantra and become free of reference points.

original: de nas bar snang du nyi ma la h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje sa bon de nyid kyis mtshan par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas bar snang du nyi ma la h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje sa bon de nyid kyis mtshan par bsams la /
translated: Then, in the sky, from the syllable hūṃ in the sun, one should imagine a variegated vajra arisen from the syllable hūṃ, marked with the seed syllable.

original: aom su mbha zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pas /
analyzed: aom su mbha zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pas /
translated: Reciting oṃ suṃbha… and so forth,

original: de las byung ba'i khva gdong ma la sogs pa brgyad kyis rang rang gi 'od kyis bkug cing dong du tshud par byas pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs rnams la phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i khva gdong ma la sogs pa brgyad kyis rang rang gi 'od kyis bkug cing dong du tshud par byas pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs rnams la phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: the eight goddesses such as Kākarūpā, arisen from that vajra, summon the hosts of obstructors with their own light and drive them into the pit, where they are to be struck with the kila.

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya /🔽sarba dusht'a na hum h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya / sarba dusht'a na hum h'um phat /
translated: oṃ gha gha ghatāya ghatāya🔽sarva duṣṭān hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: kli li k'i la ya sarba p'a pam hum h'um phat /
analyzed: kli li k'i la ya sarba p'a pam hum h'um phat /
translated: kliṃ kliṃ kīलय सर्वपापान् hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: h'um h'um h'um phat badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ro a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sarba du sht'a na bighn'am /
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um phat badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ro a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sarba du sht'a na bighn'am /
translated: hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ vajra kīलय vajra dharo ’jñāpayati sarva duṣṭān bighnān

original: k'a ya b'a ka tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: k'a ya b'a ka tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: kāya vāk citta vajra kīलय hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom badzra mudga ra badzra k'i la y'a ko ta ya hum h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra mudga ra badzra k'i la y'a ko ta ya hum h'um phat /
translated: oṃ vajra mudgara vajra kīलय कोट्टय hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: de nas lha mo brgyad po slar yang sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus kyi h'um la chud pa dang / de dag yongs su gyur pa las rim pa bzhin rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / ra ba dang / gur dang / bla re dang / mda'i dra ba dang /
analyzed: de nas lha mo brgyad po slar yang sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus kyi h'um la chud pa dang / de dag yongs su gyur pa las rim pa bzhin rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / ra ba dang / gur dang / bla re dang / mda'i dra ba dang /
translated: and from their complete transformation, the vajra ground, fence, tent, canopy, net of arrows,

original: bskal pa me dpung 'bar ba'i rnam pa can gyi me ri rnam par grub par blta'o //🔽aom me di n'i badzr'i bha ba badzra bandha h'um /
analyzed: bskal pa me dpung 'bar ba'i rnam pa can gyi me ri rnam par grub par blta'o // aom me di n'i badzr'i bha ba badzra bandha h'um /
translated: and the mountain of fire in the aspect of blazing conflagration of the eon are formed.🔽oṃ vajra-meditator be firm vajra-bond hūṃ

original: aom badzra pr'a ka ra h'um bam h'um /🔽aom badzra panydza ra h'um bo h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra pr'a ka ra h'um bam h'um / aom badzra panydza ra h'um bo h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra-door-opener hūṃ vaṃ hūṃ🔽oṃ vajra-hook hūṃ boḥ hūṃ

original: aom badzra bi t'a na h'um kham h'um /🔽aom badzra badzra sa ra dz'a la tram sam tram /
analyzed: aom badzra bi t'a na h'um kham h'um / aom badzra badzra sa ra dz'a la tram sam tram /
translated: oṃ vajra-lightning hūṃ khaṃ hūṃ🔽oṃ vajra-vajra-king of the mountains traṃ saṃ traṃ

original: aom badzra dv'a l'a na l'a rka h'um h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra dv'a l'a na l'a rka h'um h'um h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra-wind-goddess laṃ laṃ laṃ

original: de ltar bsrungs pa'i dbus su sna tshogs padma la a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma zla ba kha sbyar gyi dbus su h'um las byung zhing de nyid kyis mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha dog nag po 'od zer gyi phreng ba
analyzed: de ltar bsrungs pa'i dbus su sna tshogs padma la a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma zla ba kha sbyar gyi dbus su h'um las byung zhing de nyid kyis mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha dog nag po 'od zer gyi phreng ba
translated: Having guarded it in that way, in the center of that, on a variegated lotus, from the transformation of the vowels and consonants, in the center of the conjoined sun and moon, from hūṃ arises a five-tined vajra marked with hūṃ and a black-colored garland of light

original: 'khrigs par bltas la /
analyzed: 'khrigs par bltas la /
translated: rays.

original: lte ba'i h'um las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug rnams bkug nas de nyid du zhugs pa dang / de dag yongs su gyur pa @109b las dpal he ru ka rdo rje g-yas brkyang bas ro'i gdan la bzhugs shing grub pa'i dur khrod kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i h'um las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug rnams bkug nas de nyid du zhugs pa dang / de dag yongs su gyur pa @109b las dpal he ru ka rdo rje g-yas brkyang bas ro'i gdan la bzhugs shing grub pa'i dur khrod kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: Having visualized that, light rays arise from the hūṃ at the navel, summoning the lords of heroes and heroines, who enter there and transform into Śrī Heruka, standing on a corpse seat with the right leg straight and surrounded by the charnel grounds of spiritual practice.

original: sku mdog nag po phyag gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sku mdog nag po phyag gnyis pa ste /
translated: He is black-colored with two hands,

original: rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas rang gi shes rab la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas rang gi shes rab la 'khyud pa /
translated: holding a vajra and a bell, embracing his wisdom.

original: zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa ral pa thor tshugs kyis mtshan pa //
analyzed: zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa ral pa thor tshugs kyis mtshan pa //
translated: He has one face, three eyes, and is marked with matted hair.

original: thod pa'i phreng bas dbu la brgyan pa zla ba phyed pa dbu la 'jog pa /
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng bas dbu la brgyan pa zla ba phyed pa dbu la 'jog pa /
translated: He is adorned with a garland of skulls on his head and a half-moon on his head.

original: sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: He has a crown marked with a vajra cross.

original: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
translated: His face is contorted.

original: mche ba gtsigs shing 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs shing 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: He bares his fangs and is terrifying.

original: gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa /
translated: He has the nine moods of dance.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
translated: He has a tiger-skin skirt.

original: brgya phyed thod pa'i phreng bas do shal byas pa'o //
analyzed: brgya phyed thod pa'i phreng bas do shal byas pa'o //
translated: He has a necklace of a hundred and fifty skull-garlands.

original: mgul rgyan gdub kor rna rgyan dang // dbu yi nor bus rnam par brgyan //🔽mchod phyir thogs dang thal ba zhes //
analyzed: mgul rgyan gdub kor rna rgyan dang // dbu yi nor bus rnam par brgyan // mchod phyir thogs dang thal ba zhes //
translated: He is adorned with a necklace, bracelets, earrings, and a head jewel.🔽He has an uṣṇīṣa and ashes.

original: phyag rgya drug gis rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya drug gis rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: He is sealed with the six mudrās.

original: de'i spyan sdar bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo sku mdog dmar mo /
analyzed: de'i spyan sdar bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo sku mdog dmar mo /
translated: In his eyes are the Blessed Lady Vajravārāhī, red in color,

original: zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa ;
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa ;
translated: with one face and two arms,

original: spyan gsum pa gcer bu dum bu'i ska rags kyis brgyan pa phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: spyan gsum pa gcer bu dum bu'i ska rags kyis brgyan pa phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: with three eyes, naked, adorned with a skirt of human bone segments, and endowed with the five symbolic ornaments.

original: phyag g-yon 'khyud pa'i thod pa na //
analyzed: phyag g-yon 'khyud pa'i thod pa na //
translated: In the skull-cup held in her left embracing arm

original: gdug pa bdud kyi khrags  bsnams ma //🔽g-yas pas phyogs su sdang kun la //
analyzed: gdug pa bdud kyi khrags  bsnams ma // g-yas pas phyogs su sdang kun la //
translated: She holds a noose of the demon of evil.🔽With her right hand she makes a threatening gesture

original: rdo rje dang bcas sdigs mdzub byed //
analyzed: rdo rje dang bcas sdigs mdzub byed //
translated: toward all directions, with a vajra.

original: bskal ba'i me ltar gzi brjid che //
analyzed: bskal ba'i me ltar gzi brjid che //
translated: She is as majestic as the fire of the end of the eon.

original: khrag 'dzag pa la dgyes pa mo //
analyzed: khrag 'dzag pa la dgyes pa mo //
translated: She delights in blood.

original: byin pa gnyis kyis legs 'khril nas //
analyzed: byin pa gnyis kyis legs 'khril nas //
translated: She embraces him with her two thighs.

original: bde chen thugs rje'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: bde chen thugs rje'i bdag nyid can //
translated: She is the embodiment of the compassion of great bliss.

original: pu dz'a ao aa go r'a de m'a //
analyzed: pu dz'a ao aa go r'a de m'a //
translated: Puja o agoradame.

original: k'a ao tri ko ka la k'a hi //🔽pre gri soo su na si ma ku //
analyzed: k'a ao tri ko ka la k'a hi // pre gri soo su na si ma ku //
translated: Ka otri kokala kahi.🔽Pre gri so su nashi makhu.🔽Puli ra malaya.

original: pu lli ra ma la ya mgo la khanda ka p'a la dang rab tu gtum mo'o //
analyzed: pu lli ra ma la ya mgo la khanda ka p'a la dang rab tu gtum mo'o //
translated: On the head, Khandakapala and Prachadika.

original: dz'a landha ra spyi gtsug tu ma h'a kang ka la dang gtum mig ma'o //
analyzed: dz'a landha ra spyi gtsug tu ma h'a kang ka la dang gtum mig ma'o //
translated: In Jalandhara on the crown of the head, Mahākaṅkāla and Caṇḍākṣī.

original: ao di ya rna ba g-yas par kang ka la dang 'od ldan ma'o //
analyzed: ao di ya rna ba g-yas par kang ka la dang 'od ldan ma'o //
translated: In Oḍiyāna on the right ear, Kaṅkāla and Prabhāvatī.

original: aar bu da mgo bo'i rgyab tu mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa dang sna chen ma ste gnas so //
analyzed: aar bu da mgo bo'i rgyab tu mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa dang sna chen ma ste gnas so //
translated: In Arbuda on the back of the head, Daṇḍākṣa and Mahānāsā.

original: go d'a ba ri rna ba g-yon par lha dgra dang dpa' bo'i blo gros ma'o //
analyzed: go d'a ba ri rna ba g-yon par lha dgra dang dpa' bo'i blo gros ma'o //
translated: In Godāvarī on the left ear, Śatruṃjaya and Śūrīmatī.

original: r'a me shva ri smin ma'i dbus su 'od dpag med dang mi thung ma'o //
analyzed: r'a me shva ri smin ma'i dbus su 'od dpag med dang mi thung ma'o //
translated: In the middle of the eyebrows of Rāmeśvarī is Amitābha and Vāmana.

original: de b'i ko ta mig dag la rdo rje'i 'od dang langka'i dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: de b'i ko ta mig dag la rdo rje'i 'od dang langka'i dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: In the eyes of Devīkoṭa are Vajraprabha and Laṅkeśvarī.

original: m'a la ba dpung pa'i rtsa bar rdo rje'i sku dang shing grib ma ste nye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: m'a la ba dpung pa'i rtsa bar rdo rje'i sku dang shing grib ma ste nye ba'i gnas so //
translated: In the roots of the arms of Malava are Vajrakāya and Vṛkṣaḥ.

original: k'a ma r'u pa mchan khung dag tu myu gu can dang sa srung ma'o //
analyzed: k'a ma r'u pa mchan khung dag tu myu gu can dang sa srung ma'o //
translated: In the armpits of Kāmarūpa are Aṅkura and Dhūmrapīṭha.

original: ao tre nu ma zung la rdo rje ral pa can dang 'jigs byed chen mo @110a * //🔽ste zhing ngo //
analyzed: ao tre nu ma zung la rdo rje ral pa can dang 'jigs byed chen mo @110a * // ste zhing ngo //
translated: In the pair of breasts of Oḍra are Vajkeśa and Mahābhairavā.

original: tri sha ku ni lte ba la dpa' bo chen po dang rlung shugs ma'o //
analyzed: tri sha ku ni lte ba la dpa' bo chen po dang rlung shugs ma'o //
translated: In the navel of Triśakuni are Mahāvīra and Vāyuvegā.

original: ko sa la sna rtser rdo rje h'um mdzad dang chang 'thung ma ste nye ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: ko sa la sna rtser rdo rje h'um mdzad dang chang 'thung ma ste nye ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: In the tip of the nose of Kosala are Vajrahūṃkāra and Surābhakṣī.

original: ka lim ga la shin tu bzang po dang sngo bsangs lha mo'o //
analyzed: ka lim ga la shin tu bzang po dang sngo bsangs lha mo'o //
translated: In the throat of Kaliṅga are Subhadra and Śyāmādevī.

original: la mb'a ka mgul par rdo rje bzang po dang shin tu bzang mo ste zhing ngo //
analyzed: la mb'a ka mgul par rdo rje bzang po dang shin tu bzang mo ste zhing ngo //
translated: In the neck of Lambaka are Vajrabhadra and Subhadrā.

original: k'a nytsi snying gar 'jigs byed chen po dang rta rna ma'o //🔽hi ma la ya chu sor mig mi bzang dang khra gdong ma ste nye ba'i tshan+ngo ha'o //
analyzed: k'a nytsi snying gar 'jigs byed chen po dang rta rna ma'o // hi ma la ya chu sor mig mi bzang dang khra gdong ma ste nye ba'i tshan+ngo ha'o //
translated: In the heart is Mahābhairava and Hayakarṇī.🔽In the urinary bladder is Virūpākṣa and Kālarātri.

original: bre ta pu ri rtags la stobs po che dang 'khor lo shugs ma'o //
analyzed: bre ta pu ri rtags la stobs po che dang 'khor lo shugs ma'o //
translated: In the anus is Mahābala and Cakravegā.

original: gri ha de ba bshad lam du rin chen rdo rje dang du ma skyes ma ste 'du ba'o //
analyzed: gri ha de ba bshad lam du rin chen rdo rje dang du ma skyes ma ste 'du ba'o //
translated: In the path of excretion is Ratnavajra and Anantabijā.

original: soo r'ashta brla dag la ni rta mgrin dang ni chang 'tshod ma'o //
analyzed: soo r'ashta brla dag la ni rta mgrin dang ni chang 'tshod ma'o //
translated: In the thighs is Hayagrīva and Surābhakṣī.

original: su barna dva'i pa phyin pa gnyis su nam mkha'i snying po dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma ste nye ba'i 'du ba'o //
analyzed: su barna dva'i pa phyin pa gnyis su nam mkha'i snying po dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma ste nye ba'i 'du ba'o //
translated: In the two feet is Ākāśagarbha and Cakravarmiṇī.

original: na gar song mo rnams la dpal he ru ka dang shin tu dpa' mo'o //
analyzed: na gar song mo rnams la dpal he ru ka dang shin tu dpa' mo'o //
translated: In the two knees is Śrī Heruka and Sumbha.

original: sindhu rkang ba'i bol du padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang stobs chen ma ste dur khrod do //
analyzed: sindhu rkang ba'i bol du padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang stobs chen ma ste dur khrod do //
translated: In the ankles is Padmanarteśvara and Mahābalā.

original: ma ru mthe bo dag la rnam par snang mdzad dang 'khor los sgyur ma'o //
analyzed: ma ru mthe bo dag la rnam par snang mdzad dang 'khor los sgyur ma'o //
translated: In the toes is Vairocana and Cakravartinī.

original: ku lu t'a pus mo dag la rdo rje sems dpa' dang brtson 'grus chen mo ste nye ba'i dur khrod do //
analyzed: ku lu t'a pus mo dag la rdo rje sems dpa' dang brtson 'grus chen mo ste nye ba'i dur khrod do //
translated: At the knees are Vajrasattva and Mahāvīryā, the adjacent charnel ground.

original: de nas snying gar padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i steng du ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de nas snying gar padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i steng du ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Then, at the heart, on an eight-petaled lotus, is the wheel of pristine awareness.

original: pulli ra ma la ya la sogs par ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: pulli ra ma la ya la sogs par ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: At Pullīramalaya and so forth are the wheels of awakened body, speech, and mind.

original: kha la sogs pa sgo brgyad du dam tshig gi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: kha la sogs pa sgo brgyad du dam tshig gi 'khor lo'o //
translated: At the eight gates, such as the mouth, is the wheel of sacred commitment.🔽Having thus meditated, one should bless oneself with:

original: de ltar rnam par bsgoms te aom a'a: h'um aom sarba b'i ra yo gi n'i k'a ya b'a ka tsitta badza sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bsgoms te aom a'a: h'um aom sarba b'i ra yo gi n'i k'a ya b'a ka tsitta badza sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: oṃ āḥ hūṃ oṃ sarva-pāramitā-yoga-kāya-vāk-citta-vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ

original: aom badzra shuddha sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra shuddha sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham zhes bya bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: oṃ vajra-śuddha sarva-dharmā vajra-śuddho ’haṃ

original: snying gar aom ha rdo rje sems dpa'o //🔽spyi bor na ma hi rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: snying gar aom ha rdo rje sems dpa'o // spyi bor na ma hi rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: At the heart, oṃ ha is Vajrasattva.🔽At the crown of the head, na maḥ hi is Vairocana.

original: spyi gtsug tu sv'a h'a hu padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu sv'a h'a hu padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: At the very crown, svā hā hu is Padmanarteśvara.

original: phrag pa gnyis la boo shata he dpal he ru ka rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phrag pa gnyis la boo shata he dpal he ru ka rdo rje'o //
translated: On the two shoulders, bhouḥ and śrī Heruka, the vajra.

original: mig gnyis la h'um h'um rdo rje nyi ma'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis la h'um h'um rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: On the two eyes, hūṃ and hūṃ, the vajra sun.

original: phat ham yan lag thams cad la mtshon cha ste rdo rje rgyal po'o //
analyzed: phat ham yan lag thams cad la mtshon cha ste rdo rje rgyal po'o //
translated: Phaṭ and haṃ on all the limbs, the weapon, the vajra king.

original: dpa' bo'i go cha'o //🔽aom bam lte bar rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i go cha'o // aom bam lte bar rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: The hero’s armor.🔽Oṃ and vaṃ at the navel, Vajravārāhī.

original: ham yom snying gar gshin rje ma'o //🔽hrim mom mgrin par rmongs byed ma'o //
analyzed: ham yom snying gar gshin rje ma'o // hrim mom mgrin par rmongs byed ma'o //
translated: Haṃ and yoṃ at the heart, Yamāri.🔽Hriṃ and moṃ at the throat, Moharā.

original: hrem hrim spyi bor skyod byed ma'o //
analyzed: hrem hrim spyi bor skyod byed ma'o //
translated: Hreṃ and hreṃ at the crown, Carcika.

original: h'um h'um spyi gtsug tu skrag byed ma'o //
analyzed: h'um h'um spyi gtsug tu skrag byed ma'o //
translated: Hūṃ and hūṃ at the top of the head, Bhayamakāriṇī.

original: phat phat tsanda ki ste yan lag thams cad la mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: phat phat tsanda ki ste yan lag thams cad la mtshon cha'o //
translated: Phaṭ and phaṭ, Caṇḍikā, the weapon on all the limbs.

original: mdzub mo mdud byas gung mo rtse sprad de //
analyzed: mdzub mo mdud byas gung mo rtse sprad de //
translated: Cross the index fingers, tips of the middle fingers joined,

original: mthe @110b bong rdo rje brtan por rab tu sbyar //
analyzed: mthe @110b bong rdo rje brtan por rab tu sbyar //
translated: the thumbs firmly placed in vajra position.

original: 'di ni dpyal ba'i dbyes dbus rab bzhag nas //
analyzed: 'di ni dpyal ba'i dbyes dbus rab bzhag nas //
translated: This is the hero’s stride.

original: bskor zhing bskor bas kun du bskor bar bya //
analyzed: bskor zhing bskor bas kun du bskor bar bya //
translated: Rotating, rotating, make a complete circle.

original: rkang pa mnan cing gyen du blta //
analyzed: rkang pa mnan cing gyen du blta //
translated: Pressing the foot, look up.

original: gyen du pheem gyi sgra sogs shing //
analyzed: gyen du pheem gyi sgra sogs shing //
translated: The sound of pheṃ and so on, upward.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs pa'i //🔽dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams 'gugs //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams bzhugs pa'i // dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams 'gugs //
translated: who dwell in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
translated: Om yoga shuddha sarva dharma yoga shuddho ham.

original: de nas lag pa g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag bskor zhing mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa'i bde bar ro //
analyzed: de nas lag pa g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag bskor zhing mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa'i bde bar ro //
translated: Then, turning the right and left hands, one should experience the bliss of the binding of the dakini's net.

original: de nas / ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de nas / ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: Then, just as he was bathed

original: lha rnams kyis ni khrus gsol ba //🔽lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni khrus gsol ba // lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
translated: by the gods as soon as he was born,

original: de bzhin bdag gis khrus gsol bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis khrus gsol bya'o //
translated: in the same way I will perform the bathing🔽with the pure divine water.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta sam ya shri ye h'um /🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dang sngags brjod pa bzhin du dbang bskur bas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu la mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta sam ya shri ye h'um / zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dang sngags brjod pa bzhin du dbang bskur bas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu la mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Om sarva tathagata abhishekata samaya shriye hum.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i dbu la rnam par snang mdzad bsgom mo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i dbu la rnam par snang mdzad bsgom mo //
translated: As one recites this verse and mantra, one should confer the empowerment, visualizing Akshobhya on the head of the Bhagavat and Vairochana on the head of the Bhagavati.

original: phyi dang gsang ba'i mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis mchod de /
analyzed: phyi dang gsang ba'i mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis mchod de /
translated: One should make offerings with the special outer and secret offerings.

original: h'um dkar po las rdo rje rtse gcig pa dkar po bya dmar po las byung ba'i nor bu can sbubs kyi sgor by'a ser pos bkag pa'o //
analyzed: h'um dkar po las rdo rje rtse gcig pa dkar po bya dmar po las byung ba'i nor bu can sbubs kyi sgor by'a ser pos bkag pa'o //
translated: From a white HŪṀ, a white one-pronged vajra arises, with a gem from a red bird, and the opening of the calyx is blocked by a yellow VĀM.

original: de bzhin du yang aa dmar po las padma dmar po 'dab ma gsum pa dy'am dkar po las byung ba'i ze 'bru can dy'am ser pos sbubs kyi sgo bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang aa dmar po las padma dmar po 'dab ma gsum pa dy'am dkar po las byung ba'i ze 'bru can dy'am ser pos sbubs kyi sgo bkag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, from a red A, a three-petaled red lotus arises, with a stamen from a white DYAṀ, and the opening of the calyx is blocked by a yellow DYAṀ.

original: rang gi lte ba dang snying gar zla ba la yum gyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: rang gi lte ba dang snying gar zla ba la yum gyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: At one's navel and heart, on moon-discs, are the essence and quintessence of the Mother.

original: lkog ma dang spyi bor nyi ma la gnas pa'i dpa' bo'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: lkog ma dang spyi bor nyi ma la gnas pa'i dpa' bo'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: At one's throat and crown, on sun-discs, are the essence and quintessence of the Hero.

original: yum gyi lte ba dang snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: yum gyi lte ba dang snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: At the navel and heart of the Mother, on sun-discs, are the essence and quintessence of the Blessed One.

original: lkog ma dang spyi bor yum gyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po ste zla ba la'o //
analyzed: lkog ma dang spyi bor yum gyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po ste zla ba la'o //
translated: At the throat and crown of the Mother, on moon-discs, are the essence and quintessence of the Mother.

original: sngags kyi phreng ba de dag thams cad ni kha dog dmar po g-yon skor gyis gnas pa'i mgo gyen du bltas te /
analyzed: sngags kyi phreng ba de dag thams cad ni kha dog dmar po g-yon skor gyis gnas pa'i mgo gyen du bltas te /
translated: All of those mantra strings are red in color, and they are located in the counterclockwise direction, with their heads facing upward.

original: gnas lnga'i bar du 'od zer gyi phreng ba 'khrigs pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid du dmigs nas man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: gnas lnga'i bar du 'od zer gyi phreng ba 'khrigs pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid du dmigs nas man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: Having visualized that they are the nature of great bliss, one should manifest the offering of reality in accordance with the esoteric instructions.

original: de nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then one should recite the mantra.

original: aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam h'um h'um phat d'a ki dz'a la sam ba ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam h'um h'um phat d'a ki dz'a la sam ba ra sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ śrī vajra he he ru ru kāra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ ḍāka jālā samavara svāhā.

original: aom hr'i: ha ha hum phat /
analyzed: aom hr'i: ha ha hum phat /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ phaṭ.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: This is the essence and the close essence of the Bhagavān.

original: aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye hum h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra vairocanīye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.
Oṃ🔽

original: sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye badzra wa rnna n'i ye h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye badzra wa rnna n'i ye h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: sarva buddha ḍākinīye vajra varṇanīye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: yang na rtsa ba'i gsang sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rtsa ba'i gsang sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, one should recite the root mantra:

original: na mo bha ga ba te b'i re sh'a ya /
analyzed: na mo bha ga ba te b'i re sh'a ya /
translated: Namo bhagavate vīreśāya.

original: ma h'a kalp'a gni sanani bh'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a kalp'a gni sanani bh'a ya /
translated: Mahākalpāgni-sannibhaya,

original: dza t'a ma ku totka t'a ya /
analyzed: dza t'a ma ku totka t'a ya /
translated: jatāmukuta-utkata-āyā,

original: damshtr'a ka r'a lo gra bh'i sha na mu kh'a ya /
analyzed: damshtr'a ka r'a lo gra bh'i sha na mu kh'a ya /
translated: daṃṣṭrā-karāla-lohagṛdhrāmukha-āyā,

original: sa ha sra bhu dza bh'a su r'a ya /
analyzed: sa ha sra bhu dza bh'a su r'a ya /
translated: sahasra-bhuja-bhāsura-āyā,

original: pa ra shu p'a sho dya ta sh'u la kha tv'am ga dh'a ra ni /
analyzed: pa ra shu p'a sho dya ta sh'u la kha tv'am ga dh'a ra ni /
translated: paraśu-pāśa-udgata-śūla-khaṭvāṅga-dharaṇi,

original: by'a ghr'a dzi n'a mba ra dha r'a ya /
analyzed: by'a ghr'a dzi n'a mba ra dha r'a ya /
translated: vyāghra-ajina-varadhara-āyā,

original: ma h'a dh'u mbr'a nbha ka ra ba pu sh'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a dh'u mbr'a nbha ka ra ba pu sh'a ya /
translated: mahā-dhūmra-nabhaka-ra-vapuṣā-āyā,

original: ka ra ka ra /
analyzed: ka ra ka ra /
translated: kara kara,

original: ku ru ku ku /
analyzed: ku ru ku ku /
translated: kuru kuru,

original: bandha bandha / tra sa ya tr'a sa ya /
analyzed: bandha bandha / tra sa ya tr'a sa ya /
translated: bandha bandha, trāsa trāsa,

original: ksho bha ya ksho bha ya /🔽hroom hroom / hra: hr: phem phem /
analyzed: ksho bha ya ksho bha ya / hroom hroom / hra: hr: phem phem /
translated: kṣobhaya kṣobhaya,🔽hroṃ hroṃ, hram hram, pheṃ pheṃ,

original: phat phat / da ha da ha /
analyzed: phat phat / da ha da ha /
translated: phaṭ phaṭ, daha daha,

original: pa tsa pa tsa /
analyzed: pa tsa pa tsa /
translated: paca paca,

original: bha ksha bha ksha /
analyzed: bha ksha bha ksha /
translated: bhakṣa bhakṣa,

original: sa ba ru dhi ra aantra m'a l'a ba la mbi ni /
analyzed: sa ba ru dhi ra aantra m'a l'a ba la mbi ni /
translated: sapta-rudhira-antramālā-valamvinī,

original: grihna grihna / sa pta p'a t'a la ga ta bhu dzam ga sa rbam b'a ta rdza ya ta rdza ya /
analyzed: grihna grihna / sa pta p'a t'a la ga ta bhu dzam ga sa rbam b'a ta rdza ya ta rdza ya /
translated: gṛhṇa gṛhṇa, sapta-pātāla-gatabhujaṅga-masarva-vāḍha-arjaya tarjaya,

original: a'a ka ddhya a'a ka ddhya /
analyzed: a'a ka ddhya a'a ka ddhya /
translated: ākṛṣṭya ākṛṣṭya,

original: hrim hrim / dznoom dznoom /
analyzed: hrim hrim / dznoom dznoom /
translated: hṛm hṛm, jhṇi jhṇi,

original: kshm'am kshm'am / ham ham h'um h'um /
analyzed: kshm'am kshm'am / ham ham h'um h'um /
translated: kṣaṃ kṣaṃ, haṃ haṃ hūṃ hūṃ,

original: ki li ki li /
analyzed: ki li ki li /
translated: kili kili,

original: hi li hi li /🔽si li si li /
analyzed: hi li hi li / si li si li /
translated: hili hili🔽sili sili

original: dhi li dhi li hum h'um phat ces bya'o //
analyzed: dhi li dhi li hum h'um phat ces bya'o //
translated: dhilli dhilli hum hum phat.

original: de nas gror ma dbul bar bya ste /🔽mdun du yam dang ram las rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma'i snod kyi nang du bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga aom hram dzr'im kham h'um /
analyzed: de nas gror ma dbul bar bya ste / mdun du yam dang ram las rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma'i snod kyi nang du bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga aom hram dzr'im kham h'um /
translated: Then, offer the torma:🔽In front of oneself, from yam and ram arise wind and fire mandalas upon which are the letters a. From those completely transform into a jeweled vessel inside of which are the five elixirs and five lights, om hrīh jriṃ kham hūṃ.🔽From the letters lam mam pam tam gham, the five nectars arise and are marked by those very letters.

original: lam m'am pam t'am gi yi ge rnams las bskyed cing de dag nyid kyis mtshan par bltas la yongs su bsdus pas zhu ba'i rdzas kyi steng du h'um dkar po las byung ba'i kha tv'am ga dkar po de zhu bas ro gcig tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: lam m'am pam t'am gi yi ge rnams las bskyed cing de dag nyid kyis mtshan par bltas la yongs su bsdus pas zhu ba'i rdzas kyi steng du h'um dkar po las byung ba'i kha tv'am ga dkar po de zhu bas ro gcig tu gyur pa dang /
translated: Through complete gathering, the melting substances become one taste.

original: a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa las yi ge gsum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bkug ste yi ge gsum la zhugs pa dang / de dag kyang rim gyis 'og nas 'og tu dam tshig gi bdud rtsi dang lhan cig gi bdud rtsir bsams nas ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa las yi ge gsum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bkug ste yi ge gsum la zhugs pa dang / de dag kyang rim gyis 'og nas 'og tu dam tshig gi bdud rtsi dang lhan cig gi bdud rtsir bsams nas ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Those three syllables gradually melt into the commitment nectar below, and one should bless the nectar with the three syllables for as long as one wishes.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ma la aom aa ralli ho dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a kii n'i sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ma la aom aa ralli ho dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a kii n'i sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho //
translated: Then, with regard to the Bhagavatī, one should look with “Oṃ a ra lli ho / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / vajra-ḍākinī samaya stvaṃ dṛśya hoḥ.”

original: zhes bltas te yi ge h'um las byung ba'i dkar po'i lces drangs te gsol bas tshim par gyur par blta'o //
analyzed: zhes bltas te yi ge h'um las byung ba'i dkar po'i lces drangs te gsol bas tshim par gyur par blta'o //
translated: One should imagine that she is satisfied by drinking the nectar drawn out with the white tongue arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: de nas dur khrod na gnas pa rnams la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su ni g-yon skor /
analyzed: de nas dur khrod na gnas pa rnams la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su ni g-yon skor /
translated: Then, with regard to those who dwell in the charnel grounds, one should offer the nectar to the east and so forth in a counterclockwise direction,

original: me la sogs pa'i mtshams su ni g-yas skor gyis /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i mtshams su ni g-yas skor gyis /
translated: and to the fire and so forth in a clockwise direction.

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi sarba yarksha ra ksha sa bh'u ta pre ta pi sh'a tsa aunbam'a da aa pa sma r'a da ka da ki n+y'a da ya /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi sarba yarksha ra ksha sa bh'u ta pre ta pi sh'a tsa aunbam'a da aa pa sma r'a da ka da ki n+y'a da ya /
translated: Oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi, all yakṣa rākṣasa bhūta preta piśāca unmada apasmāra ḍāka ḍākinīs,

original: ai mam ba lim gri han ntu sa ma yar kshntu ma ma sarba siddhi rmme pra ya tstsha ntu /🔽ya thee bam ya theshtam bhu nydza tha pi ba tha m'a ti kra ma tha /
analyzed: ai mam ba lim gri han ntu sa ma yar kshntu ma ma sarba siddhi rmme pra ya tstsha ntu / ya thee bam ya theshtam bhu nydza tha pi ba tha m'a ti kra ma tha /
translated: accept this bali offering, be mindful of your samaya, and grant all accomplishments to me.🔽With your mouths full, with your bellies full, with your bliss complete,🔽grant me the fulfillment of all my desires, and purify all my obscurations.

original: ma ma sarba ka rta ya satshu kha bi shuddha ye sa @111b h'a yi k'a bha bantu h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ma ma sarba ka rta ya satshu kha bi shuddha ye sa @111b h'a yi k'a bha bantu h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Hum hum phat phat svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gnyis su brjod pas byin te de dag kyang tshim par gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gnyis su brjod pas byin te de dag kyang tshim par gyur par bsam mo //
translated: Having given the bali with the recitation of this mantra twice, one should imagine that they are satisfied.

original: de nas yang dag par mchod de yi ge brgya pa brjod nas thams cad rang gi snying ga'i yi ge h'um la chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas yang dag par mchod de yi ge brgya pa brjod nas thams cad rang gi snying ga'i yi ge h'um la chud par bya ste /
translated: Then, having made offerings and recited the hundred-syllable mantra, one should dissolve everything into the syllable hūṃ at one's heart.

original: slar de'i 'od kyis bdag he ru kar sprul te ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: slar de'i 'od kyis bdag he ru kar sprul te ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: Again, through the light of that, one emanates as Heruka and should remain in whatever way is comfortable.

original: thun mtshams phyi ma la yang snying ga'i h'um gi 'od kyis rang gi lus nyid du bsdus te /
analyzed: thun mtshams phyi ma la yang snying ga'i h'um gi 'od kyis rang gi lus nyid du bsdus te /
translated: In the subsequent session, one should again gather everything into one's own body by the light of the hūṃ at the heart.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes bya ba brjod pa la sogs pa'i sngags gsum po brjod ba sngon du 'gro bas slar yang h'um de nyid kyi 'od zer rnams kyis snga ma ltar thams cad bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes bya ba brjod pa la sogs pa'i sngags gsum po brjod ba sngon du 'gro bas slar yang h'um de nyid kyi 'od zer rnams kyis snga ma ltar thams cad bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the three mantras beginning with oṃ āḥ hūṃ, one should generate everything as before by the light rays of that very hūṃ.

original: thun bzhi pa'i mthar ni aom badzra mu:/
analyzed: thun bzhi pa'i mthar ni aom badzra mu:/
translated: At the end of the fourth session, one should request the awareness being to depart with oṃ vajra muḥ.

original: zhes bya ba ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol te snga ma ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin du byas te nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol te snga ma ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin du byas te nyal bar bya'o //
translated: As before, one should go to sleep having made the meditative stabilization of emptiness.

original: gal te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems brtan par bya bar 'dod na /🔽de tshe gang du snying gi padma kha sbyar la gnas pa /
analyzed: gal te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems brtan par bya bar 'dod na / de tshe gang du snying gi padma kha sbyar la gnas pa /
translated: If one wishes to stabilize the mind by means of the meditative stabilization of the completion stage,🔽then one should enter the mind of the self arisen experience,

original: phra bar lta ba rang byung myong ba'i sems 'jug pa //
analyzed: phra bar lta ba rang byung myong ba'i sems 'jug pa //
translated: which is seen as subtle, abiding in the joined lotus of the heart,

original: khams gsum ma lus gnyis med par ni nyer 'gro ba //
analyzed: khams gsum ma lus gnyis med par ni nyer 'gro ba //
translated: which is the nondual approach to the entire three realms.

original: gsal bar chos kyi dbyings mchog de la bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: gsal bar chos kyi dbyings mchog de la bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to that supreme realm of phenomena.

original: dbang po g-yo ba'i rta kun nang du nges par sbyar //
analyzed: dbang po g-yo ba'i rta kun nang du nges par sbyar //
translated: All the moving horses of the senses are definitely applied inward.

original: ye shes rgyal ba ma lus pa yi snod gyur cig /
analyzed: ye shes rgyal ba ma lus pa yi snod gyur cig /
translated: May it become the vessel of the wisdom of all the Victorious Ones.

original: khams gsum ma lus bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du ni nyer 'gro ba //
analyzed: khams gsum ma lus bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du ni nyer 'gro ba //
translated: Approaching as the very cause of the generation of the entire three realms,

original: mthong ba mkha' 'dra dri med dpal du gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba mkha' 'dra dri med dpal du gyur //
translated: it becomes the stainless glory that is like space.

original: sangs rgyas rjes dran sbyor ba yis //🔽chos ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes dran sbyor ba yis // chos ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
translated: By the yoga of recollecting the Buddha,🔽one should cultivate the recollection of the Dharma.

original: chos rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: chos rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of recollecting the Dharma,

original: chos kyi skur ni rang nyid 'gyur //🔽dbus na gsal byed rnam par shes //
analyzed: chos kyi skur ni rang nyid 'gyur // dbus na gsal byed rnam par shes //
translated: one will become the very embodiment of the dharmakāya.🔽In the center, consciousness is the manifest.

original: ye shes mchog ni shes rnams kyis //
analyzed: ye shes mchog ni shes rnams kyis //
translated: The supreme wisdom of the wise

original: shin tu bsgom pa goms pa las //
analyzed: shin tu bsgom pa goms pa las //
translated: is definitely manifest through the cultivation of meditation.

original: gsal bar 'di ni the tshom med //
analyzed: gsal bar 'di ni the tshom med //
translated: There is no doubt about this.🔽The unchanging sole drop

original: rtag tu snying la gnas pa yi //🔽thig le gcig pu 'gyur med de //
analyzed: rtag tu snying la gnas pa yi // thig le gcig pu 'gyur med de //
translated: always abides in the heart.

original: de sgom byed pa'i skye bo la //
analyzed: de sgom byed pa'i skye bo la //
translated: For the person who meditates on that,

original: nges par ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
translated: wisdom will definitely arise.

original: zhes bya ba'i don man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of that should be meditated on just according to the esoteric instructions.

original: de la phan yon ni /
analyzed: de la phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits are as follows:

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro thugs rje can //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro thugs rje can //
translated: The Vajra Dakini, the compassionate one,

original: 'di nyid du ni bzhugs mdzad cing //
analyzed: 'di nyid du ni bzhugs mdzad cing //
translated: resides right here,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kun byang chub sems //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kun byang chub sems //
translated: and the mind of all the perfect Buddhas

original: 'gro ba gsum po 'di la gnas //
analyzed: 'gro ba gsum po 'di la gnas //
translated: resides in these three worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽dpal 'khor @112a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro // dpal 'khor @112a * //
translated: And so forth, as stated.

original: lo sdom pa dpa' bo gcig pu'i sgrub thabs pandi ta dpal ma na ka shr'is mdzad pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: lo sdom pa dpa' bo gcig pu'i sgrub thabs pandi ta dpal ma na ka shr'is mdzad pa rdzogs so //
translated: The Sādhana of the Sole Hero, the Glorious Cakrasaṃvara, composed by the paṇḍita Śrī Maṇikaśrī.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po mkhas pa su ma ti'i spyan sngar dge slong pradzny'a k'i rtis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po mkhas pa su ma ti'i spyan sngar dge slong pradzny'a k'i rtis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: It was translated by the Indian preceptor Sumatikīrti and the bhikṣu Prajñākīrti.
